alert.note: Alert for Blount; Jefferson; Knox; Sevier (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 12 at 3:51PM CDT until August 12 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHEASTERN BLOUNT, SOUTHEASTERN JEFFERSON, SOUTHEASTERN KNOX AND CENTRAL SEVIER COUNTIES... At 451 PM EDT, the public reported flash flooding in Seymour. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... South Knoxville, Sevierville, Pigeon Forge, Pittman Center, McMahan, Kodak, Harrisburg, Kimberlin Heights, Seymour, Fairgarden, Bird Crossing, Chestnut Hill, Lake Forest, Wildwood and Great Smoky Mountains National Park. This includes the following streams and drainages... Boyds Creek, Reagan Branch, Gists Creek, Dry Fork, Bridge Creek, Nails Creek, Knob Creek, and Little Pigeon River. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
